experiments

Class BenchtopDemoSM

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.ControlClass
      • experiments.BenchtopDemoSM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

    public class BenchtopDemoSM
extends ControlClass
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is a demo experiment that provides the framework to test and debug the command structure. By default, none of the fields contain the necessary logic to begin actually issuing commands. After the program is uploaded and compiled, enter the edit menu via experiment configuration in the segaWeb Portal. Change the values for lower and upper threshold as well as valve status and command indication values. Then change the Sink Channel Soil Moisture - Name value to the channel that is to be monitored for the threshold (eg - "Spoof_Wisard_10/Triangle"). Then scroll to the bottom of the page and hit reconnect to begin issuing commands. Also verify that the ruleSMThreshold is running. Benchtop demo experiment that monitors a soil moisture channel streaming from a single-sampling WiSARD hub. The control algorithm will generate command packets that signal the WiSARD to turn on or off the irrigation valve given the soil moisture is outside of the threshold range specified.
    Author:
    jdk85
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BenchtopDemoSM.RBNBControl
      This class only provides the logic for experiment specific control and then relies on the parent class RBNBControl to provide all base level logic such as RBNB connections, getters and setters for the channel maps needed by RBNBControl, as well as general command packet structuring.

    • Method Detail

      • initParams

        public void initParams()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        This method initializes the generic experiment parameter array. Every experiment should have at least these parameters in addition to any custom experiment parameters that are added in the experiment code. The experiment code will make a super(initParams()) call before adding it's own unique parameters
        Specified by:
        initParams in interface ControlInterface
        Overrides:
        initParams in class ControlClass
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • initRules

        public void initRules()
        This method is used whenever an experiment first start or is restarted. Depending on the manner in which rules can be added, this method will most likely have to be changed
        Specified by:
        initRules in interface ControlInterface
        Overrides:

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        getMessage is just used to provide a sanity check when uploading control programs to segaWeb. The message will be displayed in the edit experiment menu and can be used to verify that the correct version of a program was uploaded.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface ControlInterface
        Overrides:
        getMessage in class ControlClass
        Returns:
        Message string (e.g. "Last edit: 01/01/1970 12:00PM")
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • createRBNBControl

        protected BenchtopDemoSM.RBNBControl createRBNBControl()
        This override is pretty important. It overrides the parent createRBNBControl class and returns an inner class from this instance instead of an inner RBNBControl class from the parent ControlClass
        Overrides:
        createRBNBControl in class ControlClass
        Returns:
